content.description: In a recent year, the distribution of age for senators in the United States Senate was unimodal and roughly symmetric with mean <math alttext="65" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>65</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years and standard deviation <math alttext="10.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years. Consider a simulation with <math alttext="200" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>200</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> trials in which, for each trial, a random sample of <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> senatorsâ€™ ages is selected and the mean age calculated.
content.question: Which of the following best describes the distribution of the <math alttext="200" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>200</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> sample mean ages?

choices.label: Approximately normal with mean <math alttext="65" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>65</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years and standard deviation <math alttext="10.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years

Approximately normal with mean <math alttext="65" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>65</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years and standard deviation <math alttext="10.6 over the square root of 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>10.6</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> years

Approximately normal with mean <math alttext="65" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>65</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years and standard deviation <math alttext="10.6 over the square root of 200" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>10.6</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>200</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> years

Approximately uniform with mean <math alttext="65" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>65</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years and standard deviation <math alttext="10.6 over the square root of 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>10.6</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> years

Approximately uniform with mean <math alttext="65" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>65</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years and standard deviation <math alttext="10.6 over the square root of 200" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>10.6</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>200</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> years

content.answer: Approximately normal with mean <math alttext="65" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>65</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years and standard deviation <math alttext="10.6 over the square root of 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>10.6</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> years
